intro: Pristimera cambodiana, commonly known as the Cambodian starling tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. It is often found in lowland forests and is valued for its ornamental appearance. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
